enWisdom: Covetousness is harmful
Covetousness is the beginning of evil

Wisdom: الْخَلَاصُ مِنْ أَسْرِ الطَّمَعِ بِاكْتِسَابِ الْيَأْسِ
enWisdom: Freedom from the captivity of covetousness is [gained] by acquiring loss of hope [in people]

Wisdom: الطَّمَعُ مُورِدٌ غَيْرُ مُصْدِرٍ وَضَامِنٌ غَيْرُ مُوفٍ
enWisdom: Covetousness makes one enter [into difficulties and humiliation] but does not make him return from it; and it gives a guarantee but does not fulfil it
The most destructive thing is covetousness
The ugliest of traits is covetousness
The worst thing is covetousness

Wisdom: بَلَاءُ الرَّجُلِ فِي طَاعَةِ الطَّمَعِ وَالْأَمَلِ
enWisdom: The tribulation of a man is in his submission to avarice and [false] and hope
The attractiveness of evil is avarice

Wisdom: خَيْرُ الْأُمُورِ مَا عَرِيَ عَنِ الطَّمَعِ
enWisdom: The best matters are those which are free from cupidity

Wisdom: ذَرِ الطَّمَعَ وَالشَّرَهَ وَعَلَيْكَ بِلُزُومِ الْعِفَّةِ وَالْوَرَعِ
enWisdom: Abandon covetousness and greediness and cling to chastity and piety
Sometimes there is a false ambition for an unseen (or lost) hope

Wisdom: عِنْدَ غُرُورِ الْأَطْمَاعِ وَالْآمَالِ تَنْخَدِعُ عُقُولُ الْجُهَّالِ وَتُخْتَبَرُ أَلْبَابُ الرِّجَالِ
enWisdom: When covetousness and false hopes deceive, the minds of the ignorant are beguiled and the intellects of people are tested
The deception of Satan allures and entices
He who instils covetousness in his soul has deceived it

Wisdom: قَدْ يَكُونُ الْيَأْسُ إِدْرَاكاً إِذَا كَانَ الطَّمَعُ هَلَاكاً [إِهْلَاكاً]
enWisdom: Loss of hope may [indeed] be an achievement [in times] when covetousness is destructive

Wisdom: مَنِ اتَّخَذَ الطَّمَعَ شِعَاراً جَرَّعَتْهُ الْخَيْبَةُ مِرَاراً
enWisdom: Whoever takes covetousness as his attire, it makes him swallow failure repeatedly

Wisdom: مَنْ حَدَّثَ نَفْسَهُ بِكَاذِبِ الطَّمَعِ كَذَّبَتْهُ الْعَطِيَّةُ
enWisdom: One who entertains the hope of [fulfilment of] false cupidity, the grant [which he receives] belies him
The foundation of evil is avarice
How good an aide of hope ambition is!
The trouble for religion is covetousness and its rectitude is [in] piety

Wisdom: نَعُوذُ بِاللَّهِ مِنَ الْمَطَامِعِ الدَّنِيَّةِ وَالْهِمَمِ الْغَيْرِ الْمَرْضِيَّةِ
enWisdom: We seek Allah’s protection from lowly coveted things and the ambitions that are disliked [by Him]
Do not covet that which you do not deserve
How bad a companion of religion covetousness is!

Wisdom: لَا تُخَاطِرْ [لَا تُخَاطِرَنَ‏] بِشَيْ‏ءٍ رَجَاءَ أَكْثَرَ مِنْهُ
enWisdom: Do not risk anything with the hope of getting more than it
